page.title: 15Arable Farming round Haywood
page.content: Tithe Barn Farm at 350 acres is the largest farm, and the only farm in the area that is totally arable. This grows barley, wheat and some oilseed rape. It has its own Combine Harvester which is used for a total of only four or five weeks each year. For the rest of the year it is stored. All the grain is stored in a new building where it is kept dry with underfloor heating until the market is right to sell. Machinery is stored in this building once the grain is sold. Several other farms grow some grain crops, contractors being used for the harvest. The other main crop in the area is grass for silage or hay, as a winter feed for the livestock. Lount Farm is unique to the area in being the only farm that uses completely organic fertilizer and no pesticides.
